OOC: Scoping out an abandoned Maximal base.  Right now they've gotten insid=
e, and are investigating.

BIC:

Tucson picks up the laugh, and the insult.=
  He narrows his optics, upon hearing the voice.

" If you think I'm so pat=
hetic, why aren't you trying to take advantage of me?  After all, I'm visua=
lly impaired.  But then again, isn't it only cowards who take advantage of =
the disabled?"  

He keeps on his toes, steps away from the CR chamber, and=
 now takes a pose as if preparing for unarmed  combat.

"Well? I'm waiting.=
"

> Tucson=
 holds his cross bow at the ready. Whatever it was that was in that base, h=
e seemed quite ready to face it. He narrows his eyes while he listens to th=
e hums and buzzing of the controls which Guardia had used to open the door.=
 
> 
> "If there are any hostiles here, I'll make sure they don't get very =
far. I like a good challenge. It's been a while since I had one."
> 
> He u=
ses his audio sensors to sweep the room. Something faint catches his sonar =
system, and he freezes, aiming his cross bow toward the source of the sound=
. The CR chambers. Once he realized what his sonar data revealed, he lowers=
 the weapon and walks toward one of the CR chambers, placing a hand on it.
=
> 
> " It's warm. It's functioning. Guardia, over here, I need you to look =
inside this CR chamber for me. See if you see anyone inside or if it's vaca=
nt. "
> 
> Frustration trickles in slightly as Tucson realizes that before =
he lost his sight he could do anything anyone requested him to do. But now =
that was not the case. There were just a few situations where a pair of eye=
s was necesary and this was one of those situations. It shows in his expres=
sion as he feels the chamber with his hand.
>
